Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: bookworm0759
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not our first, second or even third choice but was all that was available at the time. We had requested a No Smoking room but the room smelled very obviously of smoke. The manager and housekeeper were very helpful and quick to arrange an alternative room. It was no better but all that was available. The room was very large and the main bed was partitioned off from the rest of the suite. The decor looked very tired and is in obvious need of refurbishment. Wifi was not reliable and the password needed to be updated every 24 hours by contacting Reception. Breakfast was not included in the tariff, wasn't very appealing and was quite expensive. We chose to dine out after the first morning. The location was not as central as we would have liked but still only about 5 minutes by taxi from the city heart. Beggars can't be choosers but we would have preferred an alternative hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: eren_eralp
Reviews.Content: i was stayed on 05/04/2010 and six night Location is very good, but personnel was not helpful... the rooms are old and adjective. breakfest I did not like, maybe a national opinion.. as I said not bad

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: Angelira
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this central hotel in Barcelona and would never ever return. Even though the standard rooms are very big, mine was dirty and absolutely old. The walls were so thin that I could hear not only the neighbor´s television, but also them talking and laughing. The breakfast was also quite poor. But nevertheless some of the employees (except reception) were very kind.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't make a better choice!”
Reviews.Author: NicolMor
Reviews.Content: My friends and I chose this hotel for a friends' reunion in Barcelona. We stayed a weekend. Since we were five girlfriends we were looking for a hotel in a safe area, and not far away from the center. The hotel is 10 minutes walking far from Passeig de Gracia, it is in a nice and vibrant street, full of nice shops and good restaurants. Rooms were very comfortable. We booked a double and a triple room which were almost suites with king size beds and nice living rooms. The staff was very friendly and ready to help you anytime. Cleanliness and service were excellent. Breakfast was not included. We really enjoyed our stay there. Absolutely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “City Break to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Clarissa16
Reviews.Content: Decided to have a city break and chose Barcelona for 4 days. Stayed at the Guitart Grand Passage Hotel in Exiample. As there were 3 of us, we booked a triple room which included a suite of 2 rooms; one with twin beds and a TV and the other with a single bed, a sette and chair and also a TV and fridge. Unfortunately, when we arrived, we were shown into a room with three single beds which was not acceptable. The guy on Reception was very accommodating and moved us to a suite room. The rooms were large and airy with a nice balcony overlooking the street below. This is a quiet area and just what we needed. It is a short bus ride to Playa Catalunya in the centre but the hop on hop off bus is just around the corner which we utilsed for two days. This is the best way to see Barcelona and not too expensive. There are lots of little cafes just around the corner on Diagonal as the hotel is quite expesive for breakfast. I would also recommend dining at the fish restaurants next to the Marina at the beach as they tend to have special offers in the evenings. We had an exceptional meal at the La Sendaro costing 15 euros for 5 courses plus a free glass of wine. I would not however recommend the Bar Velodrome for a meal (which is opposite the Hotel) as you get a mere morsal for a considerable amount of money. I would truly recommend a vist to Barcelona as this is a lovely city and would certainly stay at the Guitart Grand Passage Hotel again. It was very safe and I never felt threatened wherever I went.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Try H
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona for a trade fare and a I had this grateful experience in this hotel. First of all, I must say that the staff was so helpful and taking care of my needs at all times. The rooms are very big and confortable, nice king size beds and nice living room with a very particular balcony facing the street. The area is very nice, with lots of shops and interesting restaurants , and very well conected. I would recomed this hotel without any doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sclaw12
Reviews.Content: For a 4 star hotel I was very disappointed. The room appeared to be nice but the chair was broken and the bath had black mould on the seal. I expected some slippers and a kettle but this was not provided. The wardrobes were huge but made an awful screech and the doors did not slide very well. There was a problem with our door, it had trouble locking. The air conditioning was non existent. The lifts were tiny and there was only 1 person on reception. It's a bit out of the way from the hub of the city so after a night out expect a walk back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok but need refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Torino74
Reviews.Content: The room is large and comfortable, the price was reasonable.Despite being in the center is not noisy at all thanks to the double window with these characteristics balcony. However the carpet in the room is something I do not like. The overall impression is not very clean. The bathroom was ok but did not give a good impression. The TV channel offering is limited and not very good. The corridors to get to the room has a strange shape, looks more like an hospital, or peraphs it was the flicking light that just needs to be fixed...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, we loved the hotel and the location!”
Reviews.Author: Dalit96
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week in Barcelona, with our two kids. We got a family room- the room was above expectations- very nice, spacious, and looks new. wood floor, two bathrooms ,large bed (for 3 ...),a living room with dining table, big balcony and lovely view. The hotel is in a nice area, but not in the center of the city. I like it- it's better than the areas with a lot of tourists and noise. There is a bus station near the hotel, 58 goes to Placa Cataluna (you can use a metro card for the bus),and just near the hotel there is a touristic bus station. metro is about 10 minutes walking. if you like to walk it's ok but we found that a taxi is an easy way and not so expensive (for family of 4). I like the location- elegant, nice and safe to walk even at night. you can find everything in the streets around- icecream, piza, tapas and more. We found a bakery along Muntaner st. and also a supermarket and fruits store. Bar Velódromo near the hotel is a good place for coffee. Finally, some good words for the wonderful staff of the hotel - we got everything we asked for- the reception service was always very friendly and helpful, and also the cleaning service. Thank you for pleasant and nice attitude . We highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful family room, tries to make money out of everything, 10mins walk from metro station, not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: skyblue32london
Reviews.Content: We went on a family holiday last summer to Barcelona and thought we found a good deal with this hotel (it was about 10-20 euros cheaper than others with family room) and we left booking quite late. The staff are able to speak English and it's located in a good area of Barcelona for traveling, however, it is at least a 10 minute walk from the nearest metro stations recommended by staff -who can speak English which is helpful- but there are a lot of buses nearby. As soon as we arrived, I realised I had left the printout of our confirmation for the booking and the woman behind the reception desk said we could use the hotel's computer. However, when we checked out we noticed that we had been charged for an hour's internet use- the gentleman at checkout did waive this fee after we explained how the first woman (probably in her 40s, dark hair, stern expression) didn't explain the full story. The room itself was very unimpressive. Everything was old. The bathroom was quite nice and towels etc were replaced daily by the cleaning lady. The extra beds were essentially sofas and VERY VERY VERY uncomfortable. The main double bed consisted of two single beds joined together (see pictures attached), but they were not as uncomfortable. A huge issue we had was the incredibly noisy middle-aged men that were in the room next to us- they were very loud and kept going until 3am. In summary- I would NOT recommend the family room and this hotel for families, but if you find a cheap deal and are going as a couple or friends then it should be okay. Barcelona itself was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Eixemple near Av. Diagonal”
Reviews.Author: Reisetiger
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel as Top Secret Hotel on lastminute.com and I can say that we were very happy with what we got. The hotel is a bit far away from any Metro stop (about 10 minute walk to three different stops) and it's also quite far to the Born area and the beach, but we liked the location as it was quite at night but you still had a lot of nice bars and restaurants around it. If you figure out the bus lines it's easy to get to the Born area or the beach in 15-20 minutes. The rooms in this hotel are all suites and really spacious. You can get an extra bed and you still have enough space. The beds are always two singles but housekeeping can keep a big sheet over both beds if you are staying as a couple. Breakfast was not included in our rate, we only had it once at 15 Euros per person. It's was ok but not fab. Coffee was bad. I'd recommend to have breakfast at Cafe Milan (which is in the same building) or Velodrome (opposite the hotel). Staff was always friendly and helpful, nothing to complain about here. Would definitly come back to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely... centrally located..will surely be back.. and recommend to all"”
Reviews.Author: sassingh1974
Reviews.Content: lovely .. boutique.hotel..... centrally located.. not too far from the airport.. but in central city.. walking distance from hop-on hop off sightseeing tour pick up points.. lovely options for breakfast in the cafes in the vicinity... lovely rooms with sepaerate area for a lounge... lovely bathrooms... aestheticlaly done up.... most important .. very centrally located... and being a boutique hotel ...you are looked after well... the stay at this hotel.. made my trip to barcelona.. more memorable...

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Maisiegogs
Reviews.Content: Good location,very central, lots of good restaurant nearby although felt very much like a TOURIST especially at the busier recommended ones.Chinese across road lovely people and service. Tapas great.room very tired, needs a serious refurbishment, we were put in smoking room, nobody gave us a choice when we booked.enjoyed sitting on balcony .wouldn't stay here again but wouldn't visit Barcelona again, a week was too long, not enough things to do for us I'm afraid. And sooo busy , usually visit states which seemed quiet in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 12ASunderlands
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with this hotel! Service and standard was very good. Location worked very well and loved not being in the middle of the touristy area. Only 10/15 minute walk into city centre. Hotel staff were welcoming and so helpful. Great area to be based with nice cafes in area. There was also a sitting area with glass balcony as well as the bedroom which was an added bonus. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay agian”
Reviews.Author: Pookielove
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel and found it to be good value for money. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. A good area to base yourself in, the La Rambla is about a 20 minutes walk away. I'm sure there are more convenient hotels located nearer the centre, but I chose this area as I have had verbal and read written feedback about how noisy it can be staying in hotels around the centre. I loved Barcelona and would definelty stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Grand Passage”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Last time I was in Barcelona I tried the Grand Passage. Quite a nice and convenient hotel. Location was nice, next to diagonal and clubs around this area but I have to warn you that it is a bit far from Las Ramblas (about 30 minutes walk) However, there is a bus that takes you from the centre and passes close to the hotel so distance to the centre is not such a problem. Rooms are OK, clean and decent. The hotel itself doesn't have any character but that's not a problem for me. Probably next time I'll give the chance to another hotel in Barcelona to prove me that it's better than GP but still I will have GP at the back of my mind.

Reviews.Title: “I'd love to go back to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Glerg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after finishing our cruise out of Barecelona Spain. We had chosen a different hotel prior to the cruise, and had received the typical European hotel - Nice, Smart, Modern, and Small - clothes couldn't hang in the closet, we had to step over the commode to enter the bathub, only one person could walk on any side of the bed at any one time. So we were expecting about the same for this place. We couldn't be more pleasantly wrong. All the rooms are suites, huge by European standards, and the price was only $8/night higher than our previous hotel. 4 people could have slept comfortably in this place, with plenty of room for luggage, clothes, supplies, etc. It's a little bit older of a hotel, but has been refurbished wonderfully. All the rooms have glassed-in balconies, with view of the street. The beds were comfortable, the shower hot and strong, with an attentive, helpful, and friendly staff - who do not appear to exsist merely to hold their hands out for a tip. We spent 4 days exploring the wonderful city of Barcelona after our cruise. We are thinking about perhaps taking another cruise to other ports out of Barcelona, and would really love to stay here again. It is a little father from the city center/La Rambla than some other hotels, but it's also more quiet and had 3 fruit/grocery shops right down the block. Plus, a bus ride to anywhere in the city is only 1.45 Euro, and a bus stop is just a block away from the hotel. Definately, definately recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocolino13ro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a silent area, very good located. You can ask for rooms direct o the reception and will find disponibility eaven you arrive late in the night. The hotel has a small parking. Personell is

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location, hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: Stang1sk
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel on short notice and settled for this one despite the poor reviews because it was one of few available. The reviews are accurate. The hotel is dated, dirty, musty smelling and needs work. Our room was expensive (likely because of the late booking) and was falling apart. We got a suite so had two bathrooms and a living room in addition to the bedroom. The spare/half bath had a mirror with some kind of stains on it so you couldn't actually see your reflection in it. The main bathroom had a light out the whole time we were there (didn't report it because we assumed the maid would notice and it would be fixed) and the shower door had come out of the wall and was barely hanging on. There was a vent in the main hallway that looked like it was about to fall down so we jokingly ran past it each day to be sure it didn't land on us. The light by the bed was falling off the wall. The carpet was ugly and loose. The TV in the living room didn't work properly. I could go on. BUT... we really liked the location as it was close to many restaurants and bars. The HOHO bus stop was right across from the hotel and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Wireless internet was free but unreliable. I wouldn't stay here again unless they do a major renovation but would look for another hotel in the neighboorhood. It was far from the regular tourist places like Las Ramblas but we liked staying in a "real" neighbourhood and enjoyed walking around the streets and stopping for meals and the odd beer surrounded by locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a lovely suite, with a few problems.”
Reviews.Author: tanyahanna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our stay at Guitart Grand Passage - the room was beautifully designed and spacious (although a little dusty in places), breakfast was good (although somewhat lacking in atmosphere) and there was a bus stop just outside the hotel with routes to Placa Catalunya and Barceloneta, as well as a city tour stop. The pros definitely outweigh the cons, and I would defininitely recommend this hotel if you can find a good deal. We'd stay again. However, I would give the following advice to people booked to stay here: 1. Don't stay in a family room - ask for a double. If you get given a family room, insist on changing if possible. The family rooms are not nice, whereas the doubles are really lovely. 2. Don't order the telepizza room service - it takes ages, arrives a bit cold and they don't supply cutlery so you'll have to go down anyway. There are plenty of restaurants and tapas bars on your doorstep - go to one of these instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MickJoyce
Reviews.Content: It's not a new hotel but it is well maintained. We walked ten minutes to the metro to get downtown but sometimes we hiked the mile to two mile distance to La Rambla and back. The rooms were larger than what I expected for Europe and the maid did a good job with our mess each day. The people all spoke English and were helpful to get us tours to Montserrat and the Flamenco dances. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but a great seafood place is a few blocks away (MariscCos).

Reviews.Title: “not great, but good location”
Reviews.Author: DinkyDavros
Reviews.Content: Glad we were only there one night. Rooms were definitely past their best. Furniture looked old and had stains. Definitely not 4 star standard. Surprised that there was not even a kettle and complimentary tea/coffee sachets - I would have thought that was a basic. Balcony was glassed in so was like a sauna to sit in. You wouldn't want to anyway as it was difficult to see through the dirt. One room off the main bedroom had obviously once been a kitchen area as the old units were there, along with a broken bed propped against the wall. Great location - lots of bars and restaurants around but it took us longer to walk to Grand Passeig as was advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a quatruple room, if you are planning a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: LosLLanitos
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs money spent, location was someway out from Paseo de gracia and the seafront. was great value as a quatruple room. excellent breakfast across the road at Bar Velodromo. Would not stay for anything longer thena weekend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, even better staff”
Reviews.Author: carl0sr0bert0
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights, the hotel is a little far out for tourists, is within 10-15 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station (Diagonal) a good walk to the Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera or Casa Battlo if you are there for the Gaudi attractions, about half an hour walk for La Rambla. The rooms were impressive, large bedrooms, lounge part was big as was the bathroom. We did not use the hotels cateting facility, but there is really nice cafe/bar right outside 'Cafe Milano', which myself and My partner went to each morning for a coffee and coissant and were not expensive to say the least , and then ate in the evenings, Good selection of tapas!! . the receptionists at the hotel had exceptional vocab and were pleasent too! Note the TV for English speaking guest is rather limited, and try an avoid using the Telepizza service, we used this on our first night there and it was slow and cold, (this is not a service supplied by Guitart, they had menu's in the room and the receptionist helped order)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: GilzD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May. The room was fantasic. Long entrance hallway with small toliet room with sink off it. Spacious living room with flat screen tv, two sofas, dining table and lovely balcony. Sliding doors open through into bedroom with decent sized mirror wardrobes, large bed (two singles together), tv, 2nd balcony and en suite large marble bathroom. Room also had mini bar. Staff were wonderful and very helpful. They could all speak great english. Perfect location, just a minute walk to Avinguda Diagonal and 10/15 min walk to La Rambla. Lovely resturants near by and a wonderful cafe directly across the road (opposite bang and olufsen shop which is under hotel). Supermarket 2 mins walk away aswell. We would definately stay here again and will recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: kiterunner67
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation at Guitart in march for 3 nights in Barcelona. Supposed to be a 4 star. Family room was big. But so dusty and dirty. Rooms were smelly . We stayed the first night. We all slept in the living room.Had to air it out. They came in and vacuumed it more . We finally packed and went looking for another hotel. So instead of sight seeing, we were trying to find another hotel in barcelona. Although I had told them how bad our room was, they still charged us for the 3 nights we had made the reservation. I know for a fact that they got someone to occupy the room the 2 nights we were not there. So they got our money and the money from the people who stayed there. Location was good. So if you want to have a good stay in barcelona, DONT stay at Guitart Grand Passage in Barcelona. Hotel is so bad.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: spdominati
Reviews.Content: Smart welcome Parking Huge room Perfect bath room Free wifi Well placed Unique in Barcelona Our new accomodation place in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Nice, natural and friendly"”
Reviews.Author: Maciek_10
Reviews.Content: First few days we have stayed in famous Arts Ritz-Carlton Hotel in Barcelona then next few days in Guitart. Guitart was much better ! - staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms much more convenient , very good location. Very good hotel - without golden lamps but very nice and frienbdly atmosphere. Maciek from Poland

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: karenbeishuizen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in suite 437 from 12 - 15 February 2010. Valentinsday in Barcelona. We could not have chosen a better hotel! When we stepped into our suite, all 42 rooms in the hotel are suites, our jaws dropped because the room was beyond our expectations! Long hallway, big marble bathroom, bedroom with kingsize bed and flatscreen tv, cosy livingroom with flatscreen tv and balcony. Slidingdoors seperated the bedroom from the livingroom. Stunning! Staff speaks excellent English and are wonderful! Location is perfect: Avenguda Diagonal is just around the corner which is the main long street in Barcelona. La Sagrada Familia is 15 minutes away by foot, Passeo de Gracia is 10 minutes away by foot. This will be our hotel in Barcelona when we come back and we will soon! Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I spend Valentins weekend...”
Reviews.Author: jasontinmar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend Valentins weekend 2010 in this lovely hotel. We had a suite on a high floor. The hotel only has suites but the price is fantastic! We paid 99 euros for 2 people a night. Location is perfect, just off Avenida Diagonal, which is the main street in Barcelona. The bathroom is huge and clean, the bedroom can be seperated from the livingroom by sliding doors. TV in the livingroom and bedroom! Staff is wonderful friendly and helpful. We are already counting the days to come back! Hotel Guitart Grand Passage will be our hotel in Barcelona from now on! Fantastic!

HotelInfo.Name: Guitart Grand Passage
HotelInfo.Address: Muntaner, 212, 08036 Barcelona, Spain
